articles.content:
S. Korean farmers hold protest meeting
   Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Over 1,500 farmers who are members of the National Federation of Agricultural Managers of South Korea reportedly held a protest meeting on Saturday and waged a violent struggle demanding settlement of farmers' debt.   They threw hundreds of rotten eggs at the building of the "National Congress for New Politics" and pulled down the party flag and burnt it.   The party made commitments to settlement of farmers' debt and reform of cooperatives during the "election" campaign, but it broke the promise, they said, strongly urging the party to take measures.   On Friday, about 25,000 members of stock-breeding cooperatives held a meeting in Youido in protest against the anti-social crimes of the ruling quarters ruining stock-breeding.

DPRK-U.S. working negotiations held 
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Working negotiations between experts, a follow-up of the March DPRK-U.S. underground facility talks in New York, were held in Pyongyang from March 31 to April 3.   At the negotiations, the experts discussed technical matters including details and method of the on-site visit to the facility in Kumchang-ri and apparatuses which visitors are allowed to carry along, a visit to be made by the U.S. side in may after paying "fees."  The sides reconfirmed that an access of the U.S. side to the facility in Kumchang-ri is from A to Z an on-site visit which will take place at the invitation of the DPRK, not an "inspection," and decided to handle working matters in compliance with this.   They agreed to continue a debate on a series of working matters in the future.

articles.title: S. Korean "government's" harsh labor policy under fire
articles.content:
Hanchongryon condemns authorities for suppression
     Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) called a press conference at Hanyang University on Friday  and condemned the authorities' suppression of it,  according to a Seoul-based radio report.   Hanchongryon declared that it decided to hold a meeting of the 7th term deputies in Seoul from April 16 to 18.It demanded that the "government" stop defining Hanchongryon as an enemy-benefiting organization and ensure its peaceful opening of the meeting.

articles.content:
About 1,000 poetical works created
   Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- About 1,000 poetical works of different themes were created by Korean poets in a little more than a year.   They highly praise the greatness of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 6th anniversary of his election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.   The poems and words of songs fully reflect all the Korean people's deep respect and reverence for and intense loyalty to Kim Jong Il who has performed immortal exploits, ceaselessly giving on-the-spot guidance.   They say that the unbreakable monolithic unity between the Supreme Commander and his soldiers and the revolutionary commanding system are the great fruition of his commanding art characterized by his love for soldiers.

articles.content:
Events held abroad to commemorate Sun's Day
    Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Colorful events were held in Tanzania, India, Guinea and Mexico from Mar. 23 to 27 with the approach of Sun's Day.   The events included a seminar, reading session, explanatory meeting and photo exhibition dealing with the revolutionary exploits of the President Kim Il Sung.
